course.title: CSI 3105 Design and Analysis of Algorithms I (3 units)
course.desc: Analysis of algorithms: worst-case analysis, complexity analysis, asymptotic notations and basic complexity classes. Algorithm design techniques: brute force, divide and conquer, dynamic programming, greedy, backtracking. Computational complexity of problems: lower bound arguments, the classes P, NP, NP-complete, dealing with NP-complete problems.Course Component: LecturePrerequisites: CSI 2110, CSI 2101 or for honors mathematics students: CSI 2110, (MAT 2141 or MAT 2143).
